references.reason: This paper introduces denoising diffusion probabilistic models (DDPMs), a foundation for many graph diffusion models and a core concept in the current work.

references.paper_title: Training diffusion models with reinforcement learning
references.reason: This paper proposes a method for training diffusion models using reinforcement learning, providing a significant advancement in aligning models with arbitrary reward signals.

references.paper_title: DPOK: Reinforcement learning for fine-tuning text-to-image diffusion models
references.reason: This paper adapts policy gradient methods to optimize diffusion models for image generation, offering insights into the challenges and solutions for similar applications in graph diffusion.

references.paper_title: Digress: Discrete denoising diffusion for graph generation
references.reason: This paper introduces Digress, a discrete diffusion model for graph generation that is used as the foundation for the current work's experimental setup and provides an essential baseline for comparisons.

references.paper_title: Score-based generative modeling of graphs via the system of stochastic differential equations
references.reason: This paper presents a score-based generative model for graphs, offering an alternative approach to graph generation and contributing to the understanding of diffusion models in graph settings.
